channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thais and Cambodians slug it out on social media, as border tensions flare
item.description: A war of words is raging on social media, a years-long battleground for Thais and Cambodians.

item.title: 7/25: The Daily Report
item.description: Kelly O'Grady reports on President Trump's Scotland trip as he faces questions about Jeffrey Epstein, sentencing in the "doomsday mom" case and more.

item.title: More than 20% of NASA's workforce requests to leave agency
item.description: About 3,870 employees have applied to depart NASA over two rounds through the Trump administration's deferred resignation program, the agency disclose...

item.title: Almost a third of people in Gaza not eating for days, UN food programme warns
item.description: Israel faces increasing pressure from Western allies to lift restrictions into the flow of aid into Gaza.

item.title: School-leavers losing their lives for Russia in Putin's war with Ukraine
item.description: Russia has promised that no 18-year-olds will be sent to fight in Ukraine, but the BBC finds many have already been killed.

item.title: Artist explores the toxic mining legacy of Zambia's 'black mountains'
item.description: A major exhibition about the dangerous lives of the boys and young men who scour slag heaps in search of copper.

item.title: UK condemns Hong Kong cash offer for help in arresting activists
item.description: David Lammy and Yvette Cooper describe the bounties as "another example of transnational repression".

item.title: Suspect taken into custody in University of New Mexico shooting that left 1 dead
item.description: The University of New Mexico campus has been shut down and students were told to shelter in place after an early morning shooting Friday.

item.title: 7/25: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: Extreme weather slams U.S. with dangerous heat and flash floods. Also, an ethics expert weighs in on advances in DNA.

item.title: 7/25: CBS Evening News
item.description: DOJ's closed-door meetings with Ghislaine Maxwell fuels pardon speculation; Bighorn lambs spotted after rescue from disease threat that decimated Texa...

item.title: Arizona woman to serve 8 years for identity theft scheme benefiting North Korea
item.description: Christina Chapman was sentenced to prison this week for her role in a scheme that the DOJ said used stolen American identities in order to help illega...

item.title: Lawmakers seek to ban federal agents from wearing masks
item.description: ICE says its employees have good reasons to hide their faces from protesters who want to dox them online, but Democrats say masked federal agents evok...

item.title: Has the Billboard Hot 100 caught the Holy Ghost?
item.description: Brittany dives into the economy behind Christian contemporary music

item.title: How the veteran-led Team Rubicon volunteers helped in the Texas flood aftermath
item.description: Over 60 volunteers with Team Rubicon, a veteran-led nonprofit disaster response organization, were among the first on the ground in Texas, helping to ...

item.title: Education Department says it's releasing more than $5 billion in frozen grants
item.description: The grants fund a wide range of education programs, including migrant education, services for English language learners and adult education.

item.title: In Epstein furor, Trump struggles to shake off a controversy his allies once stoked
item.description: President Donald Trump faces ongoing questions about the Jeffrey Epstein case, overshadowing his administrationâ€™s achievements.

item.title: Southwest Airlines flight headed to Las Vegas takes dramatic plunge in response to nearby aircraft
A man is stopped climbing the US-Mexico border wall. Under new Trump rules, US troops sound the alarm
